wikipedia_page.main: John 'Jack' Smart was a professional footballer who played for Bristol Rovers and Reading in the early twentieth century. He was born in Kingswood in what is now South Gloucestershire and after starting out with Bristol East went on to play 105 games for Bristol Rovers in the Southern League, scoring twice. He moved to Reading from Rovers in 1910.

response: Jack Smart is the name of:
*Jack Smart (cricketer) (1891–1979), Warwickshire first-class cricketer and Test cricket umpire
*Jack Smart (footballer), English footballer in the early part of the 20th century
